docs.abstract: Do the mixed results of an Oregon health care study show that government medical insurance should provide only catastrophic coverage?
docs.snippet: Do the mixed results of an Oregon health care study show that government medical insurance should provide only catastrophic coverage?

docs.abstract: Is it possible to both reform and sustain the welfare state? If so, what would that look like, and how could it inspire innovations in other countries?
docs.snippet: Is it possible to both reform and sustain the welfare state? If so, what would that look like, and how could it inspire innovations in other countries?

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Frei was an oncologist whose trailblazing use of combination chemotherapy helped make certain cancers curable for the first time.

headline.seo: Emil Frei III, Who Put Cancer Cures in Reach, Dies at 89
headline.main: Emil Frei III, Who Put Cancer Cures in Reach, Dies at 89
headline.print_headline: Emil Frei III, Who Put Cancer Cures in Reach, Dies at 89

docs.abstract: Dr Emil Frei III, oncologist who helped make certain cancers curable, dies at age 89.
docs.snippet: Dr. Frei was an oncologist whose trailblazing use of combination chemotherapy helped make certain cancers curable for the first time.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ron Finley is a crusader for planting vegetable gardens in urban areas.

headline.seo: Urban Gardening: An Appleseed With Attitude
headline.main: Urban Gardening: An Appleseed With Attitude

docs.abstract: Profile of Ron Finley, a crusader for planting vegetable gardens in urban areas; his rousing 10-minute talk at the annual TED in Long Beach, Calif, about guerrilla gardening in low-income neighborhoods, garnered him sudden notice.
docs.snippet: Ron Finley is a crusader for planting vegetable gardens in urban areas.

docs.lead_paragraph: New results from an Oregon study found that Medicaid coverage reduced the rate of depression and made low-income adults more financially secure, if not healthier.

headline.seo: Study Finds Health Care Use Rises With Expanded Medicaid
headline.main: Medicaid Access Increases Use of Care, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Expanded Medicaid Raises Use of Care

docs.abstract: Oregon Health Study published in The New England Journal of Medicine finds that Medicaid coverage reduces rate of depression but does not make adults healthier, despite more spent on health care and more visits to doctors and hospitals; study compared thousands of low-income people in Oregon who received access to Medicaid with identical population that did not.
docs.snippet: New results from an Oregon study found that Medicaid coverage reduced the rate of depression and made low-income adults more financially secure, if not healthier.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Young Movers, With a Passion for Change

docs.abstract: Contestants for the Peace First Prize, some as young as 8 years old, have devised innovative ways to fight problems like bullying and poverty in their communities.
docs.snippet: Contestants for the Peace First Prize, some as young as 8 years old, have devised innovative ways to fight problems like bullying and poverty in their communities.

docs.lead_paragraph: The story behind the approval of Procysbi, a new treatment, is an example of the important role that determined parents and disease foundations can play in supporting drug development.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Approves Raptor Drug for Form of Cystinosis
headline.main: Parental Quest Bears Fruit in a Kidney Disease Treatment
headline.print_headline: A Rare Ailment and a High Price

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves drug Procysbi to treat nephropathic cystinosis, extremely rare inherited disease that, if untreated, typically destroys the kidneys by age 10; to be sold by Raptor Pharmaceutical Corp, drug was developed with early financing from a foundation that shows the important role that determined parents can play in drug development, but also raises questions about whether society can afford to pay for drugs that treat rare illnesses.
docs.snippet: The story behind the approval of Procysbi, a new treatment, is an example of the important role that determined parents and disease foundations can play in supporting drug development.
